creator: vincent.hardy@sun.com
text:
Not sure about this one, but early investigation seem to point to a problem.
In the following SVG, there is a white strip on both sides of the graphic, 
where you would expect none.


<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<!DOCTYPE svg PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD SVG 1.0//EN" 
"http://www.w3.org/TR/2001/REC-SVG-20010904/DTD/svg10.dtd">
<svg width="75mm" height="5mm" viewBox="0 0 7500 500">
 <g style="stroke:none;fill:rgb(240,240,240)">
  <polygon points="0,0 7500,0 7500,500 0,500 0,0"/>
 </g>
 <g style="font-family:Thorndale;font-size:353;font-weight:400">
  <g style="stroke:none;fill:rgb(0,0,0)">
   <text>
    <tspan x="53" y="371">REPLACE
    </tspan>
   </text>
  </g>
 </g>
</svg>

74mm is smaller than the minimum width for the JSVGViewer.
So it won't automatically resize smaller than this size (you
can manually resize it smaller to a point).  Note that
the shortcut buttons exactly fit across the top of the viewier.
creator: deweese@apache.org
